title: 110_hr2953
content: The Act may be cited as the "Rural Broadband Access Enhancement Act" and defines eligible rural communities. The Rural Broadband Access Enhancement Act defines eligible rural communities as areas with a population of less than 20,000, not part of a larger urban area, and with a median household income below 80% of the national average. Additionally, improvements to the application process are outlined. The Rural Broadband Access Enhancement Act sets equity requirements for loan approval, stating that areas with less than 40% broadband access must have assets equal to 10% of the loan amount, and other areas must have assets equal to 15% of the loan amount. The Rural Broadband Access Enhancement Act requires a reduction in application paperwork and outreach efforts to inform areas with limited broadband service about the loan program. The Rural Broadband Access Enhancement Act prohibits loans or loan guarantees for new broadband service in communities with three or more service providers. Additionally, the Act eliminates limitations on eligibility based on the number of subscriber lines. The Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to limit the amounts available for entities with various shares of installed telephone subscriber lines. Not more than 10 percent of the funds can be used for entities with more than 10 percent of the lines in the US. The Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to limit funds for entities with specific shares of installed telephone subscriber lines. Up to 40 percent of the funds can be used for entities with 2-10 percent of the lines in the US. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON TERM OF LOANS AND LOAN GUARANTEES. Amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to set a term limit of 35 years for loans and loan guarantees. SEC. 7. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. Section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to include annual reporting requirements for the Secretary, detailing the number of applications submitted, approved, communities served, and services offered. The amended Section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 now includes reporting requirements for the Secretary, such as the type of services offered, broadband speed, response time, and outreach efforts conducted.
